solution_line_template: Carlson bought land that cost ${cost_per_sq_meter} per square meter, therefore the size of the land he bought is {cost_land_1}/{cost_per_sq_meter} = <<{cost_land_1}/{cost_per_sq_meter}={size_land_1}>>{size_land_1}.
And the size of the other land he bought is {cost_land_2}/{cost_per_sq_meter} = <<{cost_land_2}/{cost_per_sq_meter}={size_land_2}>>{size_land_2}.
Therefore the total size of the land he owns is {size_land_1}+{size_land_2}+{initial_land_size} = <<{size_land_1}+{size_land_2}+{initial_land_size}={total_land_size}>>{total_land_size}.
